reviews.review_msg: The topics he chose in this course were very interesting and he explains the concepts in a very easily understandable way. Otherwise, it is distance ed so the only contact you have is with the tutor marker. Assignments were fun to do and I thoroughly enjoyed learning about natural disasters. I wish some assignments were better explained.

Glyn is a real caring professor. He tries to encourage his students and calm their nerves before exams by giving advice and telling his students to follow their instincts. He's really caring, gives good feedback on assignments, and is understanding. Would take this class again.

I took this class after having taken one of Glyn's other classes, having enjoyed having him as a professor. This class was definitely harder. The grading is pretty straight forward- two midterms and a cumulative final, all multiple choice. You definitely need to pay attention in lecture, as the slides alone won't do it. Still a great prof.

after getting our mt marks back, I was very surprised, as was everyone else b/c almost everyone did bad.  But, he is a good prof and keeps it as interesting as he can.  u can replace ur mark w/the final, & thank god for dat!  to do good on mt or final, study notes & the textbook. IT'LL HELP!
This prof did a horrible job preparing us for the midterm. And he did a horrible job preparing us for the final exam as well.

While he is a clear, charismatic teacher with good presentations his notes are near useless and his exams are horrific.  There was a 56% average on his mid-term with a high failure rate.  Unless you can memorize an entire textbook and over 200 pages of notes steer well clear of this GPA killer.

well, he is a nice guy who tells funny jokes here and there but I can't say he is the best prof. He gives very little information regarding exams if any at all. His notes are very brief and made for the purpose of him lecturing. Exams are consisted of mc, sh/long answers and diagrams.. very demanding I say. taking it as an elective?! - BAD IDEA!!
Awesome prof. Great lecture, great stories. He's just a great teacher, he gets the point across, and he makes it easy to learn.
This guy's a great prof. His exams are pretty easy, and makes lectures fun by using humour. Just watch out for the disaster log in this class...it requires a lot of work.
Great and enthusiastic!
Sorry, in the previous rating I gave wrong name to the class. It's not IS104, it's EASC104.

Dr. Jackson is a very nice person but i would agree with some people here that his exams are a bit tough considering this is only a first year course. Other than that, he is really good at teaching and explaining concepts. People who dont understand him are probably the ones who dont do their readings! Do the readings and this class is an easy A.
terrible at teaching, very unclear and not a fair marker, however he is pretty nice but i dont know what good that will do you
very unorganized prof.  never take this prof. again :(
This prof is ridiculous, never take a class with him. He is disorganized, can't teach and his TA makes a lot of mistakes marking the exams. Overall, this class is a mess.
No Comments

EXCELLENT PROF. Would recommend! Strong lecturer, very interested in the subject & knowledgeable. Interesting course & fair marking scheme. 1 midterm, 3 'disaster logs' & a final exam. MT & final were short answer questions. The questions were fair, 100 level type Q's, so they were mainly defn's & examples. Text chapter summaries were also helpful.
IT IS SOOOOOOO HARD!!!!BRUTAL FINAL I HAVE EVER SEEN BEFORE. 22 SHORT ANSWERS AND YOU NEED TO READ THE WHOLE TEXTBOOK!

Really Really hard and heavy course. Have to read the whole textbook for the final exam. He does not post much information so students need to buy the expensive textbook and go though it themselves. Too heavy for an elective course. AVOID.
Interesting Prof, funny and clear. Just make sure to read the book since his tests are mostly MC and they'll typically be drawn from the book.
Great Prof. He made lectures really interesting and was very passionate about the subject. Exams were mostly multiple choice and not too hard if you study and attend lectures.

He's a nice guy, but seems inexperienced and is often difficult to understand. He rushes through the material, and a lot of it is not covered in the textbook. Attendance is mandatory. I found the first midterm easy, but the 2nd midterm and especially the final were brutal. Questions deliberately tricky. Would not take another class with this prof.

I have to admit: he is very funny. But sadly funny â‰  good teacher. His lecture notes are in point form and often missing a subject therefore attendance is mandatory if you want to know what he's talking about. His exams are designed based on the learning goals. ANYTHING UNMENTIONED IN THE LEARNING GOALS ARE NOT TESTED
Really nice!  Test material from his lecture!  Very enthusiastic and adds humor to the lectures!  Not too hard - really tries to ask students how he can improve
Easc 104 is a good B-science class to take, although the Prof has only a monotone, however, as long as you read the textbook,it's gonna be fine...

Good prof.  Can get monotone but nothing to worry about. Notes are excellent (all you really need). Visuals were helpful. Did not touch the textbook and still got A.  What I love most is his focus on understanding rather than memorization. GPA booster

just do your readings from the book n you will ace the class. i found dis 2day, bit 2 late though. all the lectures were recorded . login 2 ur mySFU n on easc 104 choose the options 4m digitized lectures. 4 sure the podcast wrks.

scared me in the first class. very helful, intelligent and passoinate abt easc.txt book is your bible for dis class n lecture slide is a very helpful review. treat the comment abt the confrontatin with the student as an isolated incident. the prof has enough skills to use ppt 2 run the class, the student was trying to act over smart.

I thought he was a good prof. He's interested in what he teaches. The powerpoints emphasized what to focus on, and they were helpful reminders for me at least. Should make notes from textbook though. Tests were definitely on the tougher side, still managable though.
His notes are not useful but the video clips are golds. He doesn't give you practice questions, but doing review questions in the textbook is more than enough
All you need is book, not the prof.The only reason I go to lecture is because the paticipation. The worst prof I have ever I had in SFU!!!

VERY VERY EASY!!! He is one of my best profs I have had in my undergrad and I am in my last semester. His test are very strait forward. Classes are fun and entertaining. And about the comment below, he yelled at that guy because the student was being a rude to the prof. Easy class for a science!!! GREAT PROF!

The course itself is fun but u should find another prof. All I can say about him is --bad temper!...He even shouted out at one student(Come on,that student was just trying to help )Read the text as many times as possible,  memorize ALL the stuffs from it. The lectures are completely useless!U can find those animations online by urself....

Awesome prof. Very funny and entertaining. Provides many graphics and youtube clips related to geo-hazards. His tests are easy and they follow everything from lecture. Definetly a fun course to take + GPA booster.
Good Prof
Midterms and finals were easy. Textbook and lectures were useless. Only need to look at lecture notes to do well in course.

Jeffrey's definitely the guy to take a course with! Lectures are very organized and informational. It is very easy to get a decent mark by just going to lecture and studying the lectures notes. Very little work is required for this course. His exams are super fair and he drops many hints in lectures! Simply amazing prof!

Jeff is without a doubt one of the best profs I have had at SFU.  Class is direct and no need to use the textbook if you attend regularly.  He drops lots of hints on what will be covered on exams(good mix of easy and thinking questions).  He is really down to earth, funny  and approachable.  Can not say enough nice things about him.
It was Jeff's first semester teaching and he was great! Totally chill guy and a generous marker. If you need to take a science elective he's def the guy to take it with!

I found the class very frustrating. Brent's teaching style did not work for me at all. My only successes spurred from my interest in geology, but I can honestly say that Brent's lectures gave me no significant help with the bulk of the 104 syllabus. I learned most of the material outside of lecture time. Would not take a class with him again.

Funny, articulate, and interesting. Attendance is mandatory - but not a hardship since Brent shows videos of natural disasters to entertain you. If that isn't enough to hold your interest, stare at his luscious locks and wonder whether they are supplemented by a toupee. Tests are EASY, as long as you attend & absorb lectures. A+.

His exams are hard, especially because most people who take this course have no prior background in earth science. That being said, I really enjoyed the class and found his lectures really interesting. The trick is to write down what he says, as it will turn up on the tests. I recommend this course if you are interested in earth science!

I recommend taking EASC101 before taking 104.It's pretty much an overlap.I'm in CMNS and just wanted to get my sci credits.His MTs are fair but does require SOME reading from the textbook.It's not hard if you pay attention in his lectures.He's a really chill and down to earth guy.I got to know him a bit and he's really funny and helpful one on one
Never take earth science with this prof ! this is a GPA killer, exams were really hard. His classes are boring as hell too !
Lots of memorization involved and the class is not curved.

This class was ridiculous! Most people taking the class are trying to get a science over with and he makes it very difficult. 1st midterm was not too bad but the 2nd was so hard. If you take this course with him prepare to study 10 hours a day and probably still get a terrible grade.

it was Prof. Wards first time teaching 104 and he wasn't terrible. I didn't come to every lecture studied just the pp slides a day before the midterm and got 68% (a lot of information but you just have to understand it instead of memorizing) He's really interested in his field and it makes lecture bearable as he includes slides of his own research

Terrible lecturer, attended 95% of classes and still got less than 70 on both midterms. exams are way too much understanding for what he goes over, its like you have to record him speak and relisten to it almost, the textbook is a must and there are a lot of questions based on where the disaster happens and specifics which he fails to tell you.

I honestly don't understand these horrible ratings. I found her lectures interesting, they were easy to follow (and they were 3 hours long). What I did realize though is how many people underestimate the course itself. It is not quite the same as in highschool, only similar. Pay attention in class, and you won't really need the textbook much.

KEVINNNNNN, this dude cares so much about his students and you can tell. I would legit re-take this course just so i could have him as my prof again. SO wholesome and overall just such a good person. He makes learning the course fun and engaging, and any help you need he will go above and beyond for you. Legit love this dude. 10/10 class

Used the slides that a former prof for the course used. Consequently he often read off the slides, and even commented  that he does read the slides prior to lecture. Very unprepared, unclear, unengaged, and confusing.. The course content itself isn't uninteresting, but I highly recommended taking it with a different prof.

She is the worst prof ever, do not take her. She is very biased and once she hates you. She will make sure you fail. Not understanding and humanly at all. The class is not that but she makes it worse. Never seen a worse prof than her. She will not be understanding and not spent time helping you learn. Do not ever take class with her, she not kind
she was so difficult, if you want GPA booster don't take it with her!
She is nice and contents were very interesting BUT Midterm were sooooooo difficult....you have to study hard if you take this class...
Course: Easy, Exams: Hard, Grading: Harsh but the prof is still great. She is so passionate about what she teaches. Also, she's very detailed and practical in her lectures.

The course content was very interesting and rewarding. However, the exams were very, very difficult. I would have appreciated some tips at the beginning on how to succeed in a purely cumulative course, but I know that is not a requirement on the prof's part. Still, avoid this prof. Most students WILL struggle despite spending hours studying.

Very passionate about the subject. Test and midterms were very fair and applicable. In fact with just common sense you could score very well without even touching the text book. She does not hand out free marks to brown nosers so you cant skip half the classes and expect a free A but i dont see that as a bad thing.

Absolutely brutal class, MT where insanely difficult and the final was not bad but not great. DO NOT TAKE IF U WANT TO RAISE GPA, 40% class failed or ended up with a D. Very mean too, not willing to provide extra ways to raise marks. EXPECTS WAY TOO MUCH FOR FIRST YR and def effected many ppl GPA for the worse. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

I agree that the midterms were hard, but the Final WAS NOT. When I was writing it I could tell which questions were pure "giveaways". IMO if you weren't getting close to at least 68%+ on the final you didn't study enough. I will admit that it would be difficult to do well if you didn't keep up since it was cumulative. Course topics were rewarding.

Final marks for the 298 people that stayed till the end. A+(1), A(4), A-(16), B+(12), B(25), B-(41), C+(28), C(26), C-(31), D(73), F(41). 38.25% of the class got in the D and F range. Class average was low this term and no scaling. I studied WHOLE term, no skip class, nailed around 80 for the final and only came out with a B. Both MT tricky. BEWARE
She is so mean!!!Avoid her anyways, this is the hardest course```and she always said she's not mean on exams but actually she IS!!!so hard```
she is CRAZY HARD! DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES! We have 315 people in the class and more than 100 ppl got D,F,N. (about 33% of the class!) And she doesnt scale!!

TOTALLY NOT WORTH THE MONEY I PAID FOR THIS COURSE. GWENN MAKES HER EXAMS VERY DIFFICULT AND SHE TAKES LECTURES FROM OLD PROFESSORS AND USES IT AND NOTHING ON THE MIDTERMS ARE ON THE LECTURES. SHE DOESN'T SCALE HER COURSES AND EXPECTS EVERYONE TO GET AN A, HER AVG WAS 52% AND SHE DOESN'T CARE.WORSE CLASS EVER. NOT RECOMMENDED

I am a first year student who took this course for an easy credit with no prior experience in rearth science. I found the course extremely rewarding. Gwenn Flowers is very clear and enthusiastic in her lectures. If you understand her lecture notes you will do well. Overall excellent course excellent prof.

she makes this class CRAZY HARD when it shouldnt be, its an intro easc class... i was looking at the midterm results she sent us, and it is astonishing looking at how many people scored under and around 50%...brutal
I Just finished this course. I have to say this is the hardest course i've ever taken. Her midterms and final exam are brutal! never ever take her class!!! trust me
Everyone avoid this professor. Never take her easc104. Her exams are extremely difficult and makes bunch of people failing.
AVOID HER!!!HER EXAMS ARE WAY TOO HARD, AND ITS SUPPOSE TO BE A 100 LVL COURSE!!! EVEN IF U STUDY EVERYTHING, YOU STILL WONT DO GOOD. WOULD BE WISE TO AVOID FLOWERS
Just avoid her, her exams are so difficult to study. Even though you study very hard, you never know what she is asking you.

She seems like a nice person, but do not take this class with her! Her midterms are very difficult, even considering the amount of time I put into studying..even if you understand the textbook, the questions are beyond the level of her teaching..expects too much for a 100 level class not in terms of workload but in the level of questions on mts

I had no background in earth science before, but I came out of this class wanting to know more and more!  He is intriguing to listen to and passionate about this subject.  He was excellent at answering questions and related well to students.  His exams were fair - he prepared us well for them.  Made me want to change my major!
What an amazing prof! I looked forward to every lecture. He is clearly passionate about what he teaches and it shows in his lectures. It doesn't hurt that he is young and good looking!
Passionate about nature hazards. He explains the material really well and has clear notes. He also makes a feel awkward jokes that makes class enjoyable.

I think the Spring 2009 semester was Brian's first term teaching (he was a TA before?). He was a GREAT prof! His class made me consider doing a minor in Earth Science. He goes into more detail during lectures, I don't find it enough to just read the slides. Midterms were really easy. Brian made natural hazards sexy!

His sooo nice!!! his lecture notes are veryy good!! if you read his lecture notes you'll do good on the exams~~however i dont like the fact that the lecture notes are soo colourful...waste so much ink...but other than that..his' awesome
New teacher and great guy. He has a passion for his subject so he wants to see you succeed. French accent can be a little hard to understand sometimes, but his powerpoint lectures are good.

SOOO EASY to fall asleep! Nice and flexible though (lets you write MT next day if you have 2 exams on the same day).1 short Assignment (worth 15%) was a joke. Lots of dry stuff to memorize, but if you just want an avg grade, study his review slides. Easy marker, final grade avg: 70.8 but nobody got A+ since you need 95 for that.

Boring to the power of TEN! He is a terrible speaker that can't really annunciate words, but he is very nice...plus he's into some cool music. But...since I'm here to learn and not for the music, I don't recommend taking this guy's courses.

Lectures were very boring. I fell asleep a few times. Although, if you paid attention in class and studied the power point slides you could do decent. Overall it was not the type of class I expected. I wish I could have heard the prof better, he didn't speak very clearly.
the content was very dry =S  Very hard to hear what he was saying in class, very monotone.
Boring boring boring... he posts his ppt online so not many notes to take..study hard for the midterm and final they comprise of most of your grade..good science elective if you are an arts student

he's a really nice guy, but the material is quite boring. especially if its near the evening. also, he'll give you hints on what is to come on an exam, but dont count on the exam to be "easy to fair". he said that about the midterm, but the marks werent that great (i thought). he knows what he wants in his answers. but otherwise, he a cool prof
